CatDescriptText: Mr. Fraser McElvany, 4370 Orchard Place, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Sherman Adams was guilty of misconduct in office of assistant to the President? Do you think that he should have resigned?" answer reads: "He was indiscreet, but not dishonest.  For the sake of the well being of the party, he should have resigned.  His interest comes second to that of the administration."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Fraser McElvany wearing eyeglasses and braided belt with key ring, standing on Wood Street with Raab Clothes sign in background, Downtown
